Whether you need a mortgage, credit card, savings account, or insurance coverage, we help you find and compare the best financial products for your specific needs.

When it comes to mortgages, Ratehub.ca is more than just a place to research and compare the best rates. Our goal is to give Canadians the best mortgage experience from online search to close. This means offering Canadians the mortgage tools, information and articles to educate themselves, allowing them to get personalized rate quotes from multiple lenders to compare rates instantly, and providing them with the best online application and offline customer service to close their mortgage all in one place.

Ratehub.ca has been named Canada's Mortgage Brokerage of the Year for four years straight (2018-2021). With over 12 years of mortgage experience, and over $11 billion in mortgages funded, we deliver you the best mortgage experience in Canada.

Financial institutions pay us for connecting them with customers. This could be through advertisements, or when someone applies or is approved for a product. However, not all products we list are tied to compensation for us. Our industry-leading education centres and calculators are available 24/7, free of charge, and with no obligation to purchase. To learn more, visit our [About us](https://www.ratehub.ca/about-ratehub) page.

EXPERT ADVICE

**416-499-2122**

Our experts will review your situation and offer a quick approval.

Your Name (required)

Your Email (required)

Phone Number (required)

Please leave this field empty.

We specialize in providing second mortgages in Ontario for people with bad credit. Unlike the major Canadian banks, we approve on equity, not credit.

A power of sale is a commonly used legal process in Ontario, which allows the mortgage lender to sell your property and recover their money. We stop this process and keep you at home.

We have a network of Ontario private mortgage lenders who lend on properties across Ontario. We get quotes from multiple lenders to ensure that you get the best deal.

A “Cash House Buyer” is an individual or corporation with the cash on hand to purchase real estate outright. Their goal typically is to rent or resell the property for a profit.

At Mortgage Broker Store, we are both a mortgage brokerage and a direct private lender.

In some cases, we act as a middleman between borrowers and lenders, and in other cases, we personally lend on mortgages.

For more information, visit our [About Us](https://mortgagebrokerstore.com/about) and Author Bio Pages Below:

[Jonathan Alphonso](https://mortgagebrokerstore.com/about/jonathan-alphonso)

As mortgage brokers, we can help you get the mortgage or loan that you need. We can provide low-interest rates first and second mortgages in Toronto & Ontario, private mortgages, home equity loans, stop foreclosures and power of sales in Ontario and across Canada.

At the Mortgage Broker Store, our team of dedicated agents will work to get you what you need and can save your home and finances.

Mortgage Broker Store has clients in the GTA and throughout Ontario. Wherever you are in Ontario, we can assist you.

Speak with us directly and we’ll go over the best options for your income, credit score, and property.

For additional information, visit our FAQ page here:
[FAQ](https://mortgagebrokerstore.com/faq)

Some topics below.

A mortgage is a debt that is secured by real estate. A property can have many mortgages, and they are numbered in the order in which they are placed on the property. A mortgage that is placed after a first mortgage and before a third mortgage (if applicable) is a **Second Mortgage**.

Second mortgages in Ontario are popular offerings from private and alternative lenders as many banks consider this type of investment to be too risky. Our mortgage advisors can help you determine what type of mortgage you require.

[Visit our FAQ Post for more info on “What is a Second Mortgage?”](https://mortgagebrokerstore.com/faq/what-is-a-second-mortgage)

Any non-bank mortgage lender can either be refereed to as a **Private Mortgage Lender** or an **Alternative Mortgage Lender**. Private lenders are typically individuals while alternative lenders are organizations such as trust companies, mortgage syndicates, and mortgage investment corps (MICs). These lenders primarily service people who cannot qualify for bank mortgages. These lenders have a high tolerance for risk, but charge setup fees and higher interest rates than banks do. We have many Toronto private lenders and private lenders across Ontario to fund your mortgage.

[Visit our FAQ Post for more info on “What are Private Lenders?”](https://mortgagebrokerstore.com/faq/what-is-private-lending)

When mortgage payments are not made, or other terms of the mortgage agreement are not met, the lender has the right to recover their investment via the **Power of Sale** or **Foreclosure** process. In Ontario the vast majority of mortgage lenders opt to use the power of sale process since it is faster and less costly. The key differences is that power of sale is a faster, cheaper process that allows the lender to [sell the property](https://mortgagebrokerstore.com/sell-my-house-fast-ontario) to recover their money while foreclosure grants the lender ownership of the property. Any excess profits from the property’s sale must go to the former homeowner, however this typically isn’t much. Any fees incurred by the lender to process the power of sale or foreclosure are charged back to the mortgage. The final fee at the end of the process can be upwards of $30,000 which typically results in the former homeowner receiving nothing. If you are a homeowner under power of sale or foreclosure, it is strongly recommended to deal with the situation before the lender takes control of the property.

[Visit Our FAQ Post for more info on “What is Power of Sale?”](https://mortgagebrokerstore.com/faq/can-i-stop-a-foreclosure)

A **Home Equity Loan** is any type of loan where a person’s house is used as collateral. In order to get approved for this kind of loan, the homeowner must have a sizable amount of home equity. Home equity is the difference between the value of the property and the value of the existing debts on the property. Home equity loans can take several forms including first mortgages, second mortgages, and personal loans (which may be registered as either a lien or mortgage). Home equity loans are different from Home Equity Lines of Credit (HELOC) which are revolving lines of credit and can be used similar to a credit card. Private and alternative lenders are the most common sources of high risk home equity loans.

[Visit Our FAQ Post for more info on “What is a Home Equity Loan?”](https://mortgagebrokerstore.com/faq/what-is-a-home-equity-loan)

Scarborough, East York, North York, Etobicoke and the former City of Toronto were amalgamated to form the present City of Toronto.

Scarborough is on the eastern side of Toronto, it was made up of smaller towns which include Agincourt, Guildwood, West Hill, The Bluffs , Wexford and Woburn. Scarborough has a number of near by colleges which include Seneca College, Centennial College and the University of Toronto’s Scarborough campus. There are many different shopping locations which include Scarborough Town Centre , Parkway Mall, Bridlewood Mall, Eglinton Square and Malvern Town Centre.

Some of the main north south streets in Scarborough Victoria Park, Warden Avenue, Brichmount Road, Kennedy Road, Brimley Road, McCowan Road, Markham Road, Morningside Road and Port Union Road.  The main east west roads are Kingston Road, St. Clair, Eglinton Avenue, Lawerance Avenue, Ellesmere Road, Sheppard Avenue and Finch Road.

East York has a distinct feel to it. The Beach or Beaches area is on the north side of Lake Ontario. This has always been one of the most desirable places to live in Toronto. It has fantastic older homes with a mix of new homes, condos and semi-detached homes. Queen Street East is the main area for restaurants and shopping. Danforth Avenue is home Greek town it has the best Greek restaurants in Toronto. Playter Estates is on the north side of Danforth Ave and has many older Victorian style homes. Riverdale is on the south side of Danforth Avenue has Victorian homes with detached and semi-detached homes. Leslieville is one of the hottest real estate markets in Toronto, it has a mix of detached and semi-detached homes.

The main north south roads are Woodbine Avenue, Coxwell Avenue, Greenwood Avenue, Pape Avenue, Broadview  Avenue. The main east west roads are Queen Street, Gerrard Street, Danforth Avenue and O’Conner Drive.

North York is a great area to live in with many smaller communities which include, Bayview Village, Willowdale, Don Mills, York Mills, Don Valley, Downsview, Newtonbrook and Wilson Heights. North York is also has the Bridle Path area, this is where some of the largest and most expensive homes in Canada are located.

North York has Yorkdale Shopping Centre, The Shops at Don Mills, and many other smaller shopping locations such as Peanut Plaza and Bayview Village.

Canada Mortgage Rates from 2.49% \| True North Mortgage Brokers

# The best mortgage rates in Canada.

## The lowest mortgage rates around.

## It's time for a cash-happy mortgage.

## Don't fit the mortgage mold? We can help.

## Unbiased, expert advice. Completely free.

## Online, in-store & over the phone

## Making mortgages easy breezy for over 19 years.

## Trusted in Canada with the most 5-Star Reviews in the Industry.

## We’ve helped Canadians arrange over $30 billion in mortgages.

### Apply for your Best Rate in minutes.

### Compare & Save Calculator

### Mortgage Payment Calculator

### Mortgage Renewal Reminder

### Mortgage Rate Forecast (2025-2027)

### Worried about your renewal?

### Morcado

### Should you choose a variable rate in 2025?

### Need to Spring Some Funds?

### How does a mortgage rate hold work?

### Sign Up For Our Newsletter

#### very helpful mortgage tools, just for you

#### Recent blogs and pages

###### Our Rate Guarantee

###### Social Media

###### Contact

###### Phone

###### Links

###### Select Location:

Lowest Mortgage Rate in Canada. Starting from 2.49%

**Who wants to save thousands? Or have a more flexible mortgage solution? Our guess is you.**

Get your BEST rate and better mortgage fit thanks to our exceptional 5-star service. Watch your savings add up and your stress ease down.

Canadians (like you) are looking for relief from today’s volatile rates.

Our low-rate, short-term Rate Relief® product can offer you 6 months of budget room to cope with extras, like closing costs and home expenses. You’ll be able to lock into a great rate and flexible mortgage for your next term.

Learn more about [Rate Relief](https://www.truenorthmortgage.ca/mortgage-solutions/rate-relief)

What makes your piggy bank smile? Your **best mortgage rate** to help you save lots of money. And what makes you, our client, smile? Getting the **right mortgage solution** to go with it.

Our **volume discount** gives you better rates on identical mortgages or premium products, even from your own bank. And our **expert brokers** provide flexible options to save money, time and stress.

Talk to us — it's a no-brainer. Your piggy bank will thank you.

[**Request a Call**](https://www.truenorthmortgage.ca/get-a-call-back) or [**Apply Now**](https://apply.truenorthmortgage.ca/)

**Everyone's rate is unique. What's yours?**

It's our job to get your lowest possible rate. Your rate qualification depends on certain factors, such as credit score and home equity, as per Canadian regulations. Get your details fast — there's no cost and no obligation.

Illustration purposes only. Use our [Easy Mortgage Calculator](https://www.truenorthmortgage.ca/tools/calculators) for a better look.

If you don’t meet the requirements of our lowest advertised rate, we still have you covered with more low-rate options! The
above range represents realistic rates if you don’t meet the outlined
criteria. Certain factors, such as equity in your home and credit rating, will impact your final rate. At True North Mortgage, we're committed to providing your best-possible rate for your situation.

_Additional premiums may apply to rentals, extended amortizations, non-standard properties and alternative lending options._

Big banks aren't big on flexibility. We are. Our highly trained brokers have access to so many lenders and products to help simplify your (mortgage) life.

For a straightforward mortgage application or a complex one — we take all your details into consideration because we can.

[**What is a complex mortgage?**](https://www.truenorthmortgage.ca/mortgage-solutions/complex-mortgages)

Mortgages can be stressful. Our crazy-good experts make it easy. Whether you apply online or stop by, you get a real person who cares about getting your best mortgage.

We're unified, highly trained and salaried for unbiased advice. And there's no cost or obligation while we deal with the lenders and details for you. It's a relationship for a lifetime of mortgage help — anywhere you are in Canada.

Have a ton of questions? We're ready for that (it goes hand-in-hand with saving you a pile of cash).

[**Get a call back**](https://www.truenorthmortgage.ca/get-a-call-back)

We're here for you. Get the right advice for the largest financial decision of your life.

[**Find a store close by**](https://www.truenorthmortgage.ca/locations)

[**Talk to a broker in your preferred language**](https://www.truenorthmortgage.ca/company)

We've been happily giving our clients better rates, the easy way, for many (mortgage) years. Meanwhile, big banks charge higher rates and fees, and online-only startups can't begin to match our savings service. We're still here, making light work of your mortgage.

[**Try our famous mortgage calculators!**](https://www.truenorthmortgage.ca/tools)

Better mortgages are all we do, and providing you with unbeatable service is our top priority. Let our (apparently very happy) clients do the talking — check out what people are saying about us.

[**Read Reviews**](https://www.truenorthmortgage.ca/about-us/reviews)

Having been a mortgage lender with a big bank in the past I know how much there is to consider in these transactions, and Peter was really on the ball. I'd recommend Peter's services to anyone, and if we ever need to complete any home financing we'll be back! We got very competitive rate options and are really happy with how everything turned out.

From start to finish, Kiley was there every step of the way to answer my questions and make sure the process went seamlessly. He truly made the whole experience stress-free for me, which allowed me to fully focus on finding the right home for me! If you are in need of a mortgage broker you can fully put your trust in, I highly recommend reaching out to Kiley!

Alex Savciuc is a tremendous help offering sound mortgage strategy advice. He made transferring our mortgage quick and easy, saving us thousands a year! I don’t usually leave reviews, but you deserve to work with Alex and experience the benefits!

Sukhesh Menon was instrumental in getting our mortgage approved on an extremely tight deadline. We went from offer letter to closing date in just about two weeks. Suffice to say, Sukhesh was there with us every step of the way making sure documents got in on time and we obtained approval as fast as possible while giving us a great rate. Would highly recommend him to others!

Ashish Verma at TNM was just awesome. He dealt all of our queries with extreme attention and patience. He was very responsive throughout the whole process and provided us with the best interest rate for our mortgage. His nature for going above and beyond will be remembered and shared to everyone around me.

True North Mortgage does more volume than any other broker — giving us access to the best possible rates from lenders. Plus, to get your rate even lower, we regularly sacrifice a portion of the commission paid by the lender to pass it on to you.

[**Easily get a better rate than your bank, from your bank**](https://apply.truenorthmortgage.ca/)

See for yourself how much you can save with our lower rates.

See what your monthly payment could be, with our quick and accurate calculator.

Renewal time already? That was fast. Get a reminder to save a pile of cash.

**Continually updated**. Where rates may go now and later — and what’s driving them.

Higher rates painting you into a budget corner? Get help to find a way out.

A market first. True North Mortgage now brings direct residential mortgage investment to everyday Canadians.

How to decide between variable-rate FOMO or JOMO? We can help.

As the flowers bloom this spring, so can the need for extra funds. Time for a refinance?

And how is it different from a **rate lock-in**? Learn what they are, when they help — and when they don't.

Stay current with the latest topics and mortgage news. We're about quality over quantity (we don't like spam, either), and you can unsubscribe at any time.

True North Mortgage guarantees you the lowest rate for the purchase of your Primary residence in Canada. You won't find a better rate anywhere! Shop and Compare. If you find a better rate, we'll beat it or give you $500.
